description: Mozambique Government announces the closing of schools.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down

description: Mozambique Government announces the closing of schools.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: Mozambique Government announces the closing of schools.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: Mozambique Government announces the closing of schools.
type_sub_cat: Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)

description: The President of Mozambique declares State of Emergency for 30 days, counting from the 1st of April.
Mozambique is extending state of emergency for another 30 days for the second time starting on June 1.
Mozambique suspends new visas for Chinese nationals as of January 28.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique announces mandatory home quarantine for travellers arriving from countries with more than 1000 confirmed cases of COVID-19 (China, Italy, South Korea, Iran, Germany and France)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique bans the issuing of entry visas, and cancel visas that have already been issued, measure takes place for 30 days as from March 23 UPDATE: The previous visa restrictions applied only on Chinese nationals, now apply for any new entry visas and cancels the ones already issued.
type_sub_cat: Visa restrictions (e.g. suspend issuance of visa)
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: Mozambique extends lockdown for another 30 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique extends state of emergency for 3rd time, for another 30 days, with some restrictions relaxed, starting from June 30.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mozambique announces that from March 23 on all travellers, Mozambicans or foreigners, entering the country must go into quarantine for 14 days.. UPDATE: The mandatory home quarantine was previously applied only for citizens, Mozambicans or foreigners,  arriving  from designated countries but it  now applies to any traveller entering the country.

Mozambique imposes a mandatory two-week quarantine as of April 1 to everyone who has recently been to another country or has had contact to someone who tested positive for the virus. UPDATE: The two-week mandatory quarantine now applies to everyone who has recently travelled outside the country or has had contact to someone who tested positive for the COVID-19, and not only to incoming passengers.

Mozambique bans public or private gatherings of more than 50 people (except those of national interest, such as parliament sessions). UPDATE: The allowed number of people in gatherings has been reduced from 300 to 50 people.
Mozambique prohibits all kinds of events, public or private, including religious services, for 30 days from April 1st. UPDATE: All events, public or private, are suspended until April 30
Mozambique bans public and private events with more than 300 people.
